put.description: Create a new Asset Endpoint Profile or replace an existing Asset Endpoint Profile.

patch.description: Update specific Asset Endpoint Profile properties.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The resource properties to be updated.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

get.description: List all assets in a resource group.

put.description: Create a new asset or replace an existing asset.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The resource properties to be updated.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.
The resource-specific properties for this resource.

AssetEndpointProfileListResult.description: The response of a AssetEndpointProfile list operation.

value.description: The AssetEndpointProfile items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

AssetEndpointProfileProperties.description: Defines the Asset Endpoint Profile properties.

targetAddress.description: The local valid URI specifying the network address/DNS name of a southbound device. The scheme part of the targetAddress URI specifies the type of the device. The additionalConfiguration field holds further connector type specific configuration.

userAuthentication.description: Defines the client authentication mechanism to the server.

transportAuthentication.description: Defines the authentication mechanism for the southbound connector connecting to the shop floor/OT device.

additionalConfiguration.description: Contains connectivity type specific further configuration (e.g. OPC UA, Modbus, ONVIF).

AssetEndpointProfilePropertiesTransportA.description: Defines the authentication mechanism for the southbound connector connecting to the shop floor/OT device.

ownCertificates.description: Defines a reference to a secret which contains all certificates and private keys that can be used by the southbound connector connecting to the shop floor/OT device. The accepted extensions are .der for certificates and .pfx/.pem for private keys.

certSecretReference.description: Secret Reference name (cert and private key).

certPasswordReference.description: Secret Reference Name (Pfx or Pem password)

AssetEndpointProfilePropertiesUserAuthen.description: Defines the client authentication mechanism to the server.

mode.description: Defines the mode to authenticate the user of the client at the server.

usernamePasswordCredentials.description: Defines the username and password references when UsernamePassword user authentication mode is selected.

x509Credentials.description: Defines the certificate reference when Certificate user authentication mode is selected.

AssetEndpointProfilePropertiesUserAuthen.description: Defines the username and password references when UsernamePassword user authentication mode is selected.

usernameReference.description: A reference to secret containing the username.

passwordReference.description: A reference to secret containing the password.

AssetEndpointProfilePropertiesUserAuthen.description: Defines the certificate reference when Certificate user authentication mode is selected.

certificateReference.description: A reference to secret containing the certificate and private key (e.g. stored as .der/.pem or .der/.pfx).

AssetListResult.description: The response of a Asset list operation.

value.description: The Asset items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

assetType.description: Resource path to asset type (model) definition.

externalAssetId.description: Asset id provided by the customer.

assetEndpointProfileUri.description: A reference to the asset endpoint profile (connection information) used by brokers to connect to an endpoint that provides data points for this asset. Must have the format <ModuleCR.metadata.namespace>/<ModuleCR.metadata.name>.

version.description: An integer that is incremented each time the resource is modified.

attributes.description: A set of key-value pairs that contain custom attributes set by the customer.

defaultDataPointsConfiguration.description: Protocol-specific default configuration for all data points. Each data point can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here. This assumes that each asset instance has one protocol.

defaultEventsConfiguration.description: Protocol-specific default configuration for all events. Each event can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here. This assumes that each asset instance has one protocol.

dataPoints.description: Array of data points that are part of the asset. Each data point can reference an asset type capability and have per-data point configuration. See below for more details for the definition of the dataPoints element.

events.description: Array of events that are part of the asset. Each event can reference an asset type capability and have per-event configuration. See below for more details about the definition of the events element.

status.description: Read only object to reflect changes that have occurred on the Edge. Similar to Kubernetes status property for custom resources.

name.description: The name of the data point.

dataSource.description: The address of the source of the data in the asset (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the data source on the asset.

capabilityId.description: The path to the type definition of the capability (e.g. DTMI, OPC UA information model node id, etc.), for example dtmi:com:example:Robot:_contents:__prop1;1.

observabilityMode.description: An indication of how the data point should be mapped to OpenTelemetry.

dataPointConfiguration.description: Protocol-specific configuration for the data point. For OPC UA, this could include configuration like, publishingInterval, samplingInterval, and queueSize.

eventNotifier.description: The address of the notifier of the event in the asset (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the event on the asset.

capabilityId.description: The path to the type definition of the capability (e.g. DTMI, OPC UA information model node id, etc.), for example dtmi:com:example:Robot:_contents:__prop1;1.

observabilityMode.description: An indication of how the event should be mapped to OpenTelemetry.

eventConfiguration.description: Protocol-specific configuration for the event. For OPC UA, this could include configuration like, publishingInterval, samplingInterval, and queueSize.

AssetPropertiesStatus.description: Read only object to reflect changes that have occurred on the Edge. Similar to Kubernetes status property for custom resources.

errors.description: Array object to transfer and persist errors that originate from the Edge.

version.description: A read only incremental counter indicating the number of times the configuration has been modified from the perspective of the current actual (Edge) state of the Asset. Edge would be the only writer of this value and would sync back up to the cloud. In steady state, this should equal version.

code.description: Error code for classification of errors (ex: 400, 404, 500, etc.).

message.description: Human readable helpful error message to provide additional context for error (ex: “capability Id 'foo' does not exist”).

DataPointsObservabilityMode.description: An indication of how the data point should be mapped to OpenTelemetry.

EventsObservabilityMode.description: An indication of how the event should be mapped to OpenTelemetry.

Mode.description: Defines the mode to authenticate the user of the client at the server.

values.name: Accepted
values.description: Resource has been accepted by the server.

Resource.description: Common fields that are returned in the response for all Azure Resource Manager resources

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.
